channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13468] hbase.zookeeper.quorum supports ipv6 address
item.description:
I put ipv6 address in hbase.zookeeper.quorum, by the time this string went to zookeeper code, the address is messed up, i.e. only '[1234' left.

I started using pseudo mode with embedded zk = true.

I downloaded 1.0.0, not sure which affected version should be here.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: We parse out the quorum string to figure out the ports (in case they are specified). The ports are separated via : character which I imagine would be the problem. Does ipv6 addresses work with plain zookeeper conf (putting it in zoo.cfg)? Usually, the hostnames are supplied to quorum string instead of ips.
Could the parsing done by skipping stuff in []? I understand zookeeper could consume zoo.cfg, but I'm not sure how hbase deal with zoo.cfg, could you elaborate?

I am trying to find a way to checkout and fix this issue. I didn't find a clear way to contribute from here

http://hbase.apache.org/source-repository.html

Will github pull request work?

I am trying to find a way to checkout and fix this issue. I didn't find a clear way to contribute from here

You can read through the section in the book: https://hbase.apache.org/book.html#submitting.patches. Shortly, creating a patch and attaching it here is the easiest.

ZOOKEEPER-3057  and

ZOOKEEPER-3106 ,now zookeeper server and client supports ipv6

-1 overall

Review Board:https://reviews.apache.org/r/69013/

tedyu@apache.org 

can you perform more valitity check for IPv6?e.g. there should be 8 groups.

    IMHO,we don't need to have strict validations with IP which will be very trivial.I will give a strict validation if you really want to.two option:
    A: use ready-made util directly. e.g InetAddressValidator of apache commons or something else in the Guava.
    B: implement IPUtil.java in the hbase-common module for hbase which can validate IPv4/IPv6
which one would you like?
    BTW:IPv6 like this [2001:db8::1] which don't have 8 groups
Option A seems to be better.

ping yuzhihong@gmail.com

what the QA report complains may cause from the included commons-validator jar.Could you plz give me some directions？

We should be able to use commons validator.

mdrob may have more insight on how to avoid the errors seen at the end of https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14701/artifact/patchprocess/patch-javac-3.0.0.txt

Thanks
You need to add a relocation stanza at https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/master/hbase-shaded/pom.xml#L340
